greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of psi(x) * chi(-x^3) * f(-x^16) * chi(-x^24) / phi(-x^12)^2 in powers of x where phi(), psi(), chi(), f() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/3) * eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^3) * eta(q^16) * eta(q^24)^3 / (eta(q) * eta(q^6) * eta(q^12)^4 * eta(q^48)) in powers of q.
mathematica: QP := QPochhammer; A182056[n_] := SeriesCoefficient[QP[q^2]^2*QP[q^3]* QP[q^16]*QP[q^24]^3/(QP[q]* QP[q^6]*QP[q^12]^4*QP[q^48]), {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^16 + A) * eta(x^24 + A)^3 / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^6 + A) * eta(x^12 + A)^4 * eta(x^48 + A)), n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Apr 08 2012
